start: ^A remote arctic town is facing an impending diptheria outbreak.
^All of the town's antitoxin serum is expired.
^The only way to get the serum to them in time is by dogsled.
^The journey will be perilous. Godspeed, brave travellers.

out_of_time: ^Unfortunately, you did not get to the town fast enough to avert the epidemic.
all_dead: ^Your entire party is dead. The serum is lost.  Thousands will perish.
win: ^At last, you arrive at your destination with the serum safely intact.

b: ^ may have perished, but they will be remembered as
^You eat a hearty meal of warm stew.
^You eat a meagre meal of cold bread and cheese.
^You spend an unpleasant night tossing and turning.
^You go to sleep shivering.  You wake up even colder.

warm_rest: ^You rest for a while by the fire
play_harmonica: ^You take a break to play the harmonica and dance, lightening spirits somewhat.
play_piano: ^You take a break to play the piano and dance, lightening spirits somewhat.

b: ^ has died of complications from their broken leg.
^ has died of complications from their broken nose.
^ couldn't handle it.  They ran off into the night, never to be seen again.
^ has died of a heart attack.  The stress was just too much for them.
^ has died of their many ailments.
^This is the last place to rest before your final destination.
^The fireplace is unlit and the room is cold and damp.
^ This room is equipped with adequate bedding for your whole party.
^ in the corner of the room.

roadhouse: ^Get a good night's sleep (using bedroll). (6 hours)

c-0: ^After spending some time chopping wood you are able to light a fire in the fireplace.

risk_of_death.#: Some other notes about API stuff:
- Options formatted like ((this)) are not displayed to player
good, bad, severe control text display
- currently_moving and weather are observed by the engine

s0: ^You continue past miles of inhospitable landscape.
s1: ^The harsh and unforgiving landscape rushes past as you continue on your way.
s2: ^Imposing scenery passes you by; it's too cold for you to appreciate the hostile beauty of the Arctic.
s3: ^There isn't a breath in this land of death as you hurry, horror-driven.
s4: ^There is no sound but the heavy breathing of the dogs.

b: ^The old man is still lying, unconscious, in the corner.

s0: ^You notice a bearded old man eating at a table in the corner.
s1: ^The old man is still sitting in the corner, ignoring you.

c-1: ^You approach the old man.  He glares at you.

s: ^"Delivering diptheria serum to avert an epidemic."

c-0: ^The old man snorts. "Why are you talking to me, then?"

g-0: ^The old man goes back to his meal.
^The man seems unimpressed.  "Why would you do that?"

c-2: ^"That's a shit reason.  Selfish.  Leave me alone."
^The man goes back to his meal.
c-3: ^"Who says they need saving? What if it's just their time to die?"

s: ^"Why would you say something like that?"

g-0: ^The man grunts dismissively.  "If it wasn't their time to die then God wouldn't have sent them diptheria."

c-2: ^ puches the man in the face.  A fracas ensues.

b: ^He goes down quickly. You leave him unconscious in a corner.
^ comes out of it with a broken nose.
^"That'll teach you to mess with God's plan!" cackles the old bastard.
^You decide not to pursue this any further.

c-3: ^You decide not to pursue this any further.

s0: ^Some shady-looking folks are playing craps in the corner.
s1: ^The gamblers are still playing craps in the corner.

c-0: ^ approaches the gamblers.  One of them looks up.
^"Then leave us alone" one of the others pipes up.

b: ^The gamblers get excited, until they realize that they have nothing of value that you don't already have.
^ tries to join the gamblers, but it turns out that they're not interested in anything you have to wager.
^The gamblers grumble as you take their

c-1: ^You decline the wager.  The gamblers seem annoyed, and go back to ignoring you.

bear_attack: ^You approach the next roadhouse.  It looks dark. The door seems to be damaged, hanging off the hinges.

c-0: ^You decide to carry on to the next roadhouse.
g-0: ^There seems to be blood on the walls of the roadhouse.
^Outside the building, two roughly human-sized objects are buried under freshly-fallen snow.

c-3: ^You shine your lamp through the door and see a large polar bear, its jaws covered in blood, sleeping in a corner.
c-4: ^You decide to get the hell outta there.

g-1: ^ enters the building, waking the giant polar bear sleeping in a corner.  It rises up to a truly staggering height, growling and baring its sharp teeth.

c-6: ^The rest of the party runs, leaving

b: ^You grab the shotgun and shoot the bear several times.
^It puts up a brave fight, but you eventually kill it and escape mostly unharmed.
^You attempt to engage in unarmed combat with a polar bear.
^Everyone in your party continues to have dysentery.

s0: ^The sky almost seems... too far away?
s1: ^The wind shouldn't sound like that, should it?
s2: ^It ain't being dead - it's the awful dread of the icy grave that pains...
s3: ^You get the feeling that there's something unnatural out there in the darkness.

b: ^ has started mumbling angrily to themselves.

s4: ^true altruism does not exist, and all seemingly 'selfless' acts are in fact selfishly motivated
s6: ^there is some sense in which we die every time we go to sleep
s7: ^the industrial revolution has done more harm than good
s9: ^air travel will never be commercially viable

sled_bump: ^You hit a bump in the trail.
sled_obstacle: ^A log half-covered by the deep snow emerges out of the darkness ahead.

b: ^Fortunately, the light of your lamp gives you adequate warning to avoid hitting it.
^By the time you see it there's no time to turn or stop the sled.
^ breaks a leg in the ensuing collision.

wolf_pack: ^A pack of wolves emerge from the night behind you,

s0: ^ long teeth glinting in the starlight
s1: ^bearing down on you with a surprising sense of purpose and coordination
s2: ^moving in unison with terrifying speed and precision
s3: ^chasing after you with ravenous expressions and glowing eyes
s4: ^led by a particularly ferocious animal covered in scars

wolf_pack: ^.  They're coming quickly, but your dogs are faster (hopefully).

c-0: ^You urge the dogs to run faster.  They don't need any convincing.
^Eventually the wolves give up and you escape with your life.
c-1: ^ at the wolves.  They appear to back off, but going back to retrieve the
c-2: ^You grab the shotgun and fire at the pack.  They back off.

cairn: ^You spot a long-forgotten, lonely cairn of stones.

c-1: ^Buried beneath the cairn you find only weathered, broken bones.
